explanation.rules:
Word order:
– V(O)S (V = verb; O = object; S = subject)
– QVX (Q = interrogative element)
– (which | Qt)N(D)(A) (Qt = quantity, N = noun, D = demonstrative pronouns, A = adjective)
• verb:
– le- past
– bi- future
– -si subject = plural (-gisi-si > -gisesi)
• noun: singular / plural
man: tau / tauwau
child: gwadi / gugwadi
chief: guyau / gweguyau
old woman: numwaya / nunumwaya
∼: singular = plural
• class (Cl):
– men: te- (before Qt); to-
– women/animals: na-
– children: gudi-
– canoes: ke-
– things (for example stones): kwe-
• demonstrative pronouns: (a-)ma-Cl(-si)(-we)-na, ma-to- > mto-, ma-na- > mina-
• quantity: Cl-vila how many?, Cl-tala 1, Cl-yu 2, Cl-vasi 4
